titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 52
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

p.note: A list of Latin phrases in the same hand as the rest of the manuscript. The leaf has been inserted upside down.
Top of page, in brown ink, in a modern hand: A Scipio. Below, in brown ink, in a modern hand: Sermones sacri
A loose leaf inserted at the end of the book, incipit: Tripliciter est regnum dei querendum

binding.p: Rebound in 1882. Marbled paper covers. On Royal Library label: A 52. Top, in black ink: Sign. A 52 i AntiqvitetsArkivet.

Late medieval parchment wrapper with turn-ins (some lost). The left cover is noticeably smaller at the foot, perhaps due to shrinkage. Top of cover, in brown ink: No 28. Upper left corner, label, text in brown ink: A 52. Below this, in brown ink: 24. Lower right side, vertically, in brown ink: N 50 3ius in ordine planctus ecclesie.

origin.p: Sweden, Vadstena monastery , 16th century, first half

provenance.p:
The phrase N 5:o 3ius in ordine planctus ecclesie on most likely refers to the shelfmark system in Vadstena monastery, described by Fredriksson (1997) and Nordin (2021)
. The covers may have been previously used for a work with the title Planctus Ecclesie. Monica Hedlund has suggested that the note was written by Michael Nicolai, priest-brother in Vadstena 1487-1516. He is also the scribe for National Library, A 113; see Hedlund (1980) , note 26.

The Antiquities Archive. Current signum, A 52, first established in Helin’s catalogue from the 1720s (U 91:2:2). Also mentioned in the following catalogues and inventories: U 90:4, p. 91, 24. Sermones sacri, manu antiqua; U 91:2:1; 24. Sermones sacri, manu antiqua.; U 91:5, N xx, (changed from xxviii).

acquisition.p: From the Antiquities Archive to the National Library in .

msItem.title: Nativity of the Lord
msItem.incipit: Euangelizo vobis gaudium magnum quod erit vniuerso populo
msItem.explicit: Et conuerso pax multa diligentibus legem tuam.
msItem.note: According to a librarian's note, made before the rebindning in 1882, the first text in the manuscript at that time was a sermon to St Stephen.

msItem.title: First Sunday after the Nativity
msItem.incipit: Quia dominus iesus christus in eo quod erat puer id est habitum humane
msItem.explicit: et si dignitas diuersa est in hoc seculo vna cum illis natura

msItem.title: Epiphany (excerpts)
msItem.rubric: In die epyphanie In quibus locis iesus inuentus est specialiter
msItem.incipit: A regibus voluit inueniri, in stabulo, in presepio, inter bruta animalia
msItem.explicit: sed crediderunt et obedienciam prestiterunt pausantes illa die et nocte scilicet per naues

msItem.title: First Sunday after the Epiphany
msItem.rubric: Dominica prima post octauas epyphanie Euanglium Johannis In illo tempore nuptie facte sunt in chana galilee
msItem.incipit: Ubi est aduertendum est quod non ociose sed certi racione misterii dominus noster
msItem.explicit: precepit dominus vinum ferri vt de vino iudicare

msItem.title: Second Sunday after the Epiphany
msItem.rubric: Dominica secundo post octauas epiphanie Euangelium Mathei 8
msItem.incipit: In illo tempore post quam scilicet cum predicauit iesus in monte tabor
msItem.explicit: Sic peccator non curat damna anime sue spiritualia seu corporalia.

msItem.title: Pentecost (excerpts)
msItem.incipit: Si quis diligit me et sermonem meum seruabit
msItem.explicit: Certe eorum premium erat horribilium demonum fletus et stridor dencium mors et inferus

msItem.title: Unidentified sermon
msItem.rubric: Triplices ad quos non venit spiritus sanctus
msItem.incipit: Primi sunt ad quos numquam venit, vt sint peccatores obstinati et mali
msItem.explicit: Omnia vero arescant,et tu solus mihi dulcescas, sint mihi omnia penalia, Tu solus mihi consolatorius

msItem.title: Feast of St Catherine
msItem.rubric: In die katerine virginis Euangelium Matt 13
msItem.incipit: Uirtus et sapientia dei dominus noster iesus christus non solum ad suscipiendam humanitatem
msItem.explicit: vbi iam ultra multos tribus aureolis resplendit

msItem.title: Unidentified sermon
msItem.incipit: Colligerunt bonos et malos Hieronymus dissoluit hanc questionem per verba apostoli ad romanos
msItem.explicit: Vocati enim sunt omnes ad quos cristiane fide pervenit.

msItem.title: Unidentified sermon
msItem.incipit: Premissa sane erant vobis scribenda prout loci istius calamitas

msItem.title: Seventh Sunday after Pentecost (excerpts)
msItem.incipit: In proxima dominica audiuimus plura de homicidio corporali et spirituali
msItem.explicit: quo viso mater compuncta iam cepit urgere eum ad dandum

msItem.title: Day of the Holy Innocents
msItem.explicit: qui per etatem librii arbitrii voluntatis vsum non habebant

msItem.title: Excerpts and annotations
msItem.incipit: Venite benedicti ac si dicat illis maledictis
msItem.explicit: Et dicunt aliqui doctores quod ad mediam noctem durauit
msItem.note:
Excerpts from Jacobus de Voragine, Sermones quadragesimales; Beda Venerabilis.
Blank pages.

msItem.title: Laetare Sunday (fourth Sunday in Lent)
msItem.incipit: In illo tempore abiit iesus trans mare galilee

watermark.term: Coat of arms with deer horns.

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation in brown ink fo 1-50 (18 skipped); foliation fo 37-50 originally foliated 33-46.
supportDesc.condition: Several folios stained and worn, with stains and smudges; loose; torn, with ink stain.

p.note: In brown ink, in a medieval hand: Pen-trials. Single words and phrases.
In brown ink, a (perhaps intentionally) grammatically incorrect sentence, in a medieval hand: Dominini noster iesum christi
Bottom of page, in dark brown ink, in a medieval hand: Non nobis domine sed nomine tuo da gloriam Maria mater gracias mater
Top of page, in brown ink, in a medieval hand: Scribbles; alfa delta and several words that cannot be read due to text loss.

decoNote.p: : Penwork initials in brown ink over 2-3 lines.
